description: Last issue saw the revelation of the Puritans, a secretive and highly technologically advanced organization whose sole purpose is to eradicate all Kherubim and Daemonites from the face of the earth. Can Max Cash get to his brother, Grifter, in time to warn the Cats of the coming danger. What deadly secret does the Coda trained Olympia hide? Plus, introducing two new players, Mythos, the immortal human weapon, and Eve, a young woman brimming with immense psionic power.
name: Survival Of The Species, Part. 2 : Hits and Mythos

description: The mysterious Coda trained Olympia's secret is revealed. And, Zealot challenges her to a dual to the death. Plus, the Puritans enact an all out assault on the WildC.A.T.s' headquarters.
name: Survival Of The Species, Part. 3 : Predator & Prey

description: The Puritans attacked the WIldC.A.T.s on their home turf, now it's their turn to repay the favor. But when the team storms the Puritan's headquarters they learn the disturbing magnitude of the organization's plans. They plan to travel back in time to when the Kherubim and Daemonite first arrived on Earth and destroy the alien bloodline before it can begin.
name: Survival Of The Species, Part. 4 : Fight Or Flight

description: The Puritans, a highly technologically advanced organization out to eliminate all Kherubim and Daemonites from the planet, plan to rewrite history. If the WildC.A.T.s want to continue to exist they'll have to follow Gina and her elite strike team on a dangerous trek back through time. First stop...smack dab in the middle of World War I. "Recruitment!" Story by Brandon Choi. Art by Carlos D'Anda. Get a look at how the Puritans recruited some of the highly skilled operatives.
name: Endangered Species, Part. 1 : For Whom the Bell Tolls...! / Recruitment

description: As the WildC.A.T.s pursue the Puritans back through time they find themselves in the middle of World War I. There two Red Cross soldiers with familiar faces (Ernest Hemingway and Frank Cash, Grifter and Max's grandfather) help them avoid the Axis troops. But things get worse when they discover a Daemonite warlord plans to turn the tide of the war by unleashing toxic gas!
name: Endangered Species, Part. 2 : Brothers In Arms

description: The WildC.A.T.s adventure back through time continues and they next find themselves in the Himalayan Mountains and cross paths with a certain explorer by the name of Marco Polo. It's on these snow cape peaks that, after a near death experience, Olympia and Max Cash discover they have a growing affection for one another.
name: The High Road To China

description: 700 years in the past, the WildC.A.T.s arrive in fabled Shangri-La, but soon learn sinister elements are afoot. If the Cats and the explorer Marco Polo are to survive their visit, one of the team members will have to make the ultimate sacrifice.
name: Paradise Lost

description: Sister Eve has made the ultimate sacrifice so that her teammates can continue their pursuit of the Puritans, a secret cabal who are hellbent on traveling back through time and destroying the Kherubim and Daemonite bloodlines at their source. Next stop...ancient Rome and the Coliseum! Plus, the surprise return of a villain from the WildC.A.T.s past.
name: Circus Maximus

description: Can the Cats survive a stint as gladiators? Maybe with a little help from a certain super-powerful Kherubim Lord. What is the diabolical Helspont doing in ancient Rome? Plus, will another member of the team fall by the wayside?

The Puritans, a highly technologically advanced organization, has sent an elite strike force back in time to eradicate the Kherubim and Daemonite bloodlines from the face of the planet forever. Hot on their heels, the WildC.A.T.s arrive in the far flung past onboard the very space vessel that brought the Kherubims to planet Earth. Get an insightful look at characters like Zealot, Marlowe, Savant, and Majestic as they were thousands of years ago.
name: Memories of Tomorrow

description: It's an all out war between the Kherubim and the Daemonites. Stuck in the middle of it all are the WildC.A.T.s desperately trying to prevent the Puritans from changing the course of history. This penultimate issue to the Cat's biggest adventure has action, intrigue, and more character defining moments than you can shake a stick at.
name: When Worlds Collide Part 1

description: It all comes to a head. Gina, an operative of the Puritans, has made it back to the dawn of time when aliens first arrived on Earth. Will she succeed in destroying the Kherubim and Daemonite bloodlines forever, or can the WildC.A.T.s, who have already lost two members on their trek back through time, stop her? It's an action packed and explosive conclusion to the biggest WildC.A.T.s adventure of all time!
name: When Worlds Collide Part 2

description: Final issue. In three separate yet related tales the WildC.A.T.s bring closure to many of their loose ends while setting the stage for their future. "Old Feelings!" Story by James Robinson. Art by Jim Lee and Scott Williams. Spartan and Voodoo discuss their past and future together on the team. All while in the middle of a life or death battle with the villainous Slag. "The Last Goodbye!" Story by Brandon Choi and Jonathon Peterson. Art by Ed Benes, Al Vey, and JD. Max Cash says his final goodbyes before expiring. Grifter tracks down his brother's assassin and learns this was a vendetta that reached across the sands of time. "Reincarnation!" Story by Alan Moore. Art by Travis Charest and JD. Savant, Grifter, Majestic, and Maxine Manchester are confronted by a forgotten villain. Plus, the seeds for the future are planted. Includes and afterward by Jim Lee, a 4-pages preview sketchbook for the new Wildcats series by Scott Lobdell and Travis Charest, and a pinup of the team by Scott Williams. Cover by Jim Lee and Scott Williams.
name: Old Feelings!

description: DC's next wave of 80-Page Giants begins with this one-shot tying into the "Chain Lightning" storyline and featuring a story of THE KINGDOM's Kid Flash! Explore the many ages of The Flash as…13-year-old Wally West gets some help from the Golden Age Flash as he foils some crafty collectibles crooks; Kid Flash helps his fellow Teen Titans battle an aging epidemic and Wally attempts to juggle his new responsibilities as The Flash. Plus, Flash teams with Captain Cold and the Golden Glider.

The new Flash gets his taste of "JLApe: Gorilla Warfare!" The takeover of the Earth continues as the new claimant to the name of Flash finds himself transformed into...the Fastest Ape Alive! But surely the other masters of the Speed Force will help set him right, right? Well, not if you're thinking of the just-transformed Jape Garrick, Max Monk-ury and Chimpulse.

Two Flashes meet an entire team of Argentine heroes in an explosive "Planet DC" Annual! Written by Chuck Dixon (NIGHTWING, Marvel Knights) with stunning art by Alcatena (WEIRD WAR TALES SPECIAL, BATMAN OF ARKHAM), Flash Jay Garrick and Argentina's greatest heroes are held captive by eerie supernatural forces. One of the heroes, Salamanca, uses her mystical powers to summon Flash Wally West to their side. But will he be enough to turn the tide against an army of the strangest beings any of our heroes have ever encountered? Plus, a backup story reveals Salamanca's origin.

1. Fired! part 1 (starring the Flintstones)
 
2. Fired! part 2 (starring the Jetsons)
 
2.Did They Really Have Calendars in the Stone Age? (factual article)
name: Fired!

description:
Flintstones - Dino gets a job on "Baywatchdog" and lives the stars life.  

Jetsons - George breaks the master dispositron and nobody can clean up their garbage!

name: It's About Time

description: Somehow, certain heroes start to lose their powers, while others are unaffected or find their abilities augmented in "Resonance."
name: Resonance

description: If an armada of alien warships wasn't enough, the heroes must contend with their failing powers and a wave of unknown energy! Will Highfather finally provide the answers that could mean salvation for all reality? Find out in "Edge of Destruction."
name: Edge of Destruction

description: While Takion and Metron gather some of the heroes to aid the Source, the others are left to deal with the forces of Apokolips before Darkseid can harness the Godwave in "Event Horizon."
name: Event Horizon!

description: The energy wave threatening all is about to converge at the center of reality! How can the weakened heroes possibly prevent Darkseid's scheme for cosmic domination from coming to pass? The cataclysmic conclusion in "Last God Standing."
name: Last God Standing

description:
Contents and Publishing details

This book contains the very first Usagi Yojimbo appearance and story by Stan Sakai: "The Goblin of Adachigahara", the illustrated poem "The Lion and the Unicorn" by Lela Dowling, and part two of "Erma Felna, EDF" by Steve Gallacci.

Only 2,000 copies were ever printed of this issue, and these are the only copies that will ever exist. The original negatives have been lost and the original art is scattered. Although Stan never sells original art from his stories, he does sell cover art. In 2001 David "Wily Pueo" Gravatt snatched up the original art for this cover at the San Diego Comic Con. I've added a scan of this to my gallery. To make reprints even more unlikely, Stan used 'zip-a-tone', cut-out sheets of screentone, on the cover and some of the internal art making it impossible to scan these images with any quality. He learned from his mistake and did not continue to use 'zip-a-tone' in later work.

This book is considered the "holy grail" for Usagi collectors due to its rarity. It can be found from time to time, but with extraordinary price tags attached.

Reprints of the stories

The Usagi story was reprinted in the Usagi Yojimbo: Summer Special and in the Usagi Yojimbo TPB #1: The Ronin, although some of the art was altered due to the use of 'zip-a-tone' in the original. Both parts of Steve Gallacci's "Erma Felna, EDF" was reprinted in Gallacci's Command Review volume. The Lela Dowling poem has yet to be reprinted.

Plot of "The Goblin of Adachigahara"

Miyamoto Usagi is out late at night, alone, walking in the snow. He comes across a hut and requests shelter from its inhabitant, an old woman. She agrees, and the two share a meal.

Trading stories, Usagi learns that the woman's husband was killed in the battle at Adachigahara, a battle that he himself had fought in. Usagi shares his recollection of the bloody encounter. He reveals that the forces of his Lord Mifune would likely have been victorious, had not the traitorus General Toda betrayed his lord to the enemy Lord Hikiji. Usagi tells the old woman that there is a goblin in the area, and worries that she is alone. She claims that it is not her karma to be killed by a goblin, and offers him a spare futon to spend the night on. The two retire for the night.

Goblin footsteps approach from outside. The goblin breaks into the hut and destroys the samurai's futon. Finding bundles of firewood instead of his intended prey, the beast finds Usagi prepared for battle. Usagi is victorious. However, much to his surprise, the old woman appears and begins to weep over the corpse of the goblin. It was her husband, General Toda. She tells Usagi the story of Toda's banishment from Lord Hikiji's clan after his betrayal of Lord Mifune. Tortured by his act of betrayal, Toda retired to this mountain hut to be alone with his shame. Over time, Toda became the monster Usagi had just killed. The old woman asks Usagi to kill her for her decit, but he refuses. Having avenged his lord, Usagi departs, but promises to send for a priest to put her husband's soul to rest.
name: Albedo Anthropomorphics #2

description:
Feel the heat as famed model and actress Alley Baggett comes alive in the pages of the new comic Alley Cat! Enter a twisted world of supernatural evil and Machiavellian deceit set in modern-day New Orleans, as one woman uncovers the truth behind the life of the Marquis de Sade and his notoriously bizarre exploits in the early 19th century. Swept up in the never-ending battle between competitive supernatural forces seeking control of earth, Alley undergoes a baptism of fire in an adventure that will shape the reality of the Third Millennium. From the creative minds behind Lady Pendragon, Avengelyne and Deity, comes Image's Alley Cat!

Notes:

  • Special center pullout poster which is a larger and more complete version of the Wizard World cover. Photo by Bruce Brown and photo layout by Greg Aronowitz.
  • One page text piece thanking the fans, a "special thanks to" section and a photo of Alley Baggett.
  • "Alley Cat" "Who was the Marquis De Sade?" one page text piece by Matt Hawkins and Bob Napton.
TypeEditionCreator(s)Sidebar Location
PaintedDorian Painted Edition Dorian Cleavenger1
PhotoWizard World EditionGreg Aronowitz2
PhotoAnother Universe EditionGreg Aronowitz3
PhotoMain CoverGreg Aronowitz4

Famed model and actress Alley Baggett continues to turn up the heat in the pages of Alley Cat! Women are being brutally murdered in New York city in identical fashion to the historical exploits of the Marquis de Sade. Alley is thrust into a dark world as all the supernatural horrors that men and women are normally oblivious to become painfully clear in her eyes. Alley's flashbacks to late 18th century France provide clues to the identity and whereabouts of the killer.

Notes:

  • Special center pullout poster which is a larger and more complete version of the Ally Baggett and spotted leopard cover. Photo by Bruce Brown and photo layout by Greg Aronowitz.
  • One page text piece thanking the fans, a "special thanks to" section and a photo of Alley Baggett.
  • "First Issue Cover Gallery" one page featuring four covers produced for issue one.

Concluding the introductory chapter of Alley Baggett1s Alley Cat! The violent slayings of prostitutes in New Orleans continues in an eerie parallel to historic events in the past. Forced to embrace her greatest fears in order to confront the tormenting demonic spirit of the Marquis de Sade, Alley1s world is shattered when she discovers the host body for the Marquis1 exploits. Not to be missed!

Notes:

  • Special center pullout photo poster. Photo by Bruce Brown and photo layout by Greg Aronowitz.
  • Appendix: "Alley Cat" "The Malleus Maleficarum" one page text piece.
  • Appendix: two pages featuring "First Appearance of Alley Cat", which occurred in Lady Pendragon #3. "Alley Cat No. 2 Monster Mart Edition" the only way to obtain this one of a kind special edition cover is at monstermart.com. "The Alley Cat Vs. Lady Pendragon On-Line Exclusive" you must register at wiizardmall.com to get this one. and "Alley Cat Continues in November with No. 4." This series was only intended as a three issue mini-series but due to high demand it will continue as a regular series. Also included are one photo several covers and artwork of Alley Baggett.

The saga continues as Alley has to come to terms with the death of her fiance and the symbiotic relationship she has with the leather suit crafted and possessed by the Marquis de Sade. An unusual balance of her innocence and the evil of the leather suit acts as a beacon to the supernatural world-- wreaking havoc on New Orleans as creatures from beyond the pale start arriving en masse. What is the connection between the Marquis de Sade and Alley Cat? Why was she led to the suit? What is the connection to a Satanist cult? Find out in the first chapter in the ongoing saga of Alley Cat!

Notes:

  • "Part 1 the Martyr" written by Bob Napton and Matt Hawkins, penciled by Bosco, inked by Tie, colors/design & production by Brett Evans and lettered by Comicraft's Albert Dechesne.
  • "Iron Wings Special Preview" written and penciled by Jay Juch, inked by Mostafa Moussa, colored by Tom Chu. and special thanks to Matt Hawkins, Glenn Urieta, Kevin Estrada, Edwin Rosell and Brett Evans. A five page special sneak peek at the upcoming Iron Wings comic.
  • "The Magdalena" two page text piece with questions and answers on the upcoming Magdalena series.
  • "Gary Frank" two page text piece with questions and answers from Gary Frank.
name: Part 1 of "the Martyr" / Iron Wings Special Preview

description:
The new story continues! Following the climatic events of last issue, Alley continues her journey into the heart of darkness! Shocking revelations await as she plunges into a bizarre battle against occult forces bent on her destruction! Will Alley fight the influence of the malevolent powers that stir within her soul or will she finally succumb and embrace evil?!

Notes:

  • Story takes place on August 24th.
  • "Regarding Vampires and Other Strange Things at the Hawkins House" two page text piece and artwork with questions and answers by Matt Hawkins.
  • "Keu Cha & a 40" two page text piece and artwork with questions and answers Keu Cha interviewed by Sonia Im.
name: The Martyr, Part 2

description:
Part 2 of The Martyr! Two more Priests are brutally murdered as the police look to Alley for some sort of answer to these unsettling crimes. What is her connection to the murders? Why are these Priests being brutally slaughtered? What does Qabbalistic Judaism and the Occult have to do with it all?

Notes:

  • Story takes place on August 24th and September 21st.
  • "Keu Cha & a 40" three page text piece and artwork and photos with questions and answers Keu Cha interviewed by Sonia Im.
  • The final issue of this series was also available from Dynamic Forces in a gold foil edition
name: The Martyr, Part 3

description:
Overview

After more than a year, Tara STILL doesn't feel like she's fitting into the Scooby Gang. The closer she gets to Willow, the more envious she is of the friendship between Will and Buffy and Xander. With all this jealousy in the air, is it any wonder there are little green monsters popping up all around?
name: Ugly Little Monsters, Part 2

description:
Overview

The Death of Buffy story continues as Willow, Xander, and the gang attempt to fend off an encroaching invasion of black magic lizard wizards. They've come to Sunnydale to resurrect an old friend and to tear the Slayer's pretty little guts out. Unfortunately for them, Buffy and her guts are six feet under. Unfortunately for Buffy's pals, these reptiles are willing to settle for the guts of the Slayer's friends and family. Written by Tom Fassbender and Jim Pascoe, the dastardly duo who brought Buffy fans the False Memories and Out of the Woodwork storyline. Illustrated by Cliff Richards and Joe Pimentel, the artists who have become the favorite of Buffy fans all over the world.
name: Death of Buffy, Part 2

description:
Overview

New monthly writer Scott Lobdell (X-Men, High Roads) kicks off his debut arc on Buffy! Joining established Buffy artist Cliff Richards, Lobdell begins his run by wrapping up four years worth of stories, featuring many returning faces. This story, climaxing in issue fifty, paves the way for a whole new direction for the Buffy comics, giving everyone more bang for their buck.

Loose ends will be tied up. Secrets will be revealed.
name: Note From The Underground, Part 1 also known as Hellmouth To Mouth (Part 1)

description:
Overview

Scott Lobdell wraps up his first apocalyptic run on Buffy with a special fiftieth issue, featuring more story pages, as well as two backup features: a prose story by Lobdell, with illustrations by Paul Lee; a short comic by Andi Watson; and a wraparound painted cover by regular cover artists Lee and Brian Horton. "Hellmouth to Mouth" concludes as Buffy finally rescues Xander and Dawn from the crew that's nearly destroyed Sunnydale -- The Scourge! They soon find that the only thing worse than the Scourge is their secret leader, revealed this issue! Buffy's not just fighting for her friends' and family's lives, she's fighting for a chance to live her own life, to be more than a fearless vampire hunter. Who better to have backing her up than former sadistic Slayer Faith and the vampire hunting vampire himself, Angel?!
name: Note From The Underground, Part 4  also known as Hellmouth To Mouth (Part 4)

description:
The Buffy monthly takes a bold new direction under the guidance of former X-Men writers Lobdell and Nicieza.

It's 1996, and Buffy Summers has just accepted her role as the Vampire Slayer. After the destruction of her high school, and her subsequent expulsion, she and Pike flee to Las Vegas as much to sort out her life as to follow a vampire lead. Meanwhile, the Watchers council tries to decide who to replace Merrick with. And, a strange and powerful vampire seems to also be taking an interest in the events in Las Vegas.

Narrated by Buffy's boyfriend Pike, this comic takes you where the TV show never did, back to the roots of everything, in the summer before Buffy arrived in Sunnydale. And there's a tall, dark, and handsome stranger keeping an eye on her during those dangerous nights in Vegas. The saga of the Slayer begins again with a new direction for Dark Horse's monthly series!
name: Viva Las Buffy - Act 1: Broken Parts

description:
Before Buffy ever arrived in Sunnydale, she did a little stint in Vegas. Not exactly doing what we have her pictured here, but we couldn't resist...

Buffy and Pike take jobs at the Golden Touch Casino to investigate whatever sinister vampire related plot is afoot there. Angelus is busy working his way up the ranks behind the scenes at the casino too, but to what end? And finally, will Giles resort to forbidden magic just to win the chance to be Buffy's next watcher?
name: Viva Las Buffy - Act 2: Full House

description: In 'Deuces Wild' Buffy finally meets the owners of the Golden Touch casino and vampire factory, and they are certainly not what she was expecting! Meanwhile, Angel seems to be trapped in the same casino - 70 years earlier! And Pike is beginning to have grave reservations about his relationship with Buffy!
name: Viva Las Buffy - Act 3: Deuces Wild

description: Buffy and Angel simultaneously fight two sets of related villains in two different times in the same place. While Buffy and Pike try to deal with the evil behind the Golden Touch Casino, Angel is making history. And across the pond, Rupert Giles has to resort to the Dark Arts to ensure that his rival doesn't become Buffy's Watcher... but in so doing will he make himself unfit for the job?
name: Viva Las Buffy - Act 4: The Big Fold

description:
Overview

Continuing the look into Buffy's life before Sunnydale, we take a detour with Dawn -- a mysterious package is accidently delivered to the younger Summers sister, and the enchanted teddy bear Hoopy wreaks havoc upon the life of the little ten year old. Intended to destroy the Slayer, the gift leads Dawn unwittingly into her first adventure, years before she'd ever be accepted into the Scooby Gang.

It's the all Paul Lee issue! Paul Lee, creator of Lurid and longtime cover artist on the Buffy series, writes, draws, colors, letters, and provides both photo and art covers for this special, hilarious issue.
name: Dawn and Hoopy the Bear

description: Buffy seems to have lost everything in Las Vegas, her job, her boyfriend, and her direction. With nowhere else to go, she returns home... only to find that Dawn has read her diary, and that vampires are not the only creatures of the night a Slayer has to deal with!
name: Slayer, Interrupted - Act 1

description:
Considering that she burned down the school gym and ran off to Vegas, and the strange entries in her diary, Buffy Summers' parents see no other choice than to have her committed. At the mental institution, Buffy sort of likes not having to slay vampires and demons night after night. But is even this institution free of supernatural threats?

And while Giles' black magic stopped a corrupt Watcher from destroying the Council, he now has to face the consequences of dabbling in the forbidden arts.
name: Slayer, Interrupted - Act 2

description:
Buffy is interested in getting 'better'. She really doesn't want to be 'the Slayer', and maybe the therapists can make that happen. On the other hand, if she ignores the pleas of those around he who claim to be victims of the supernatural, isn't she guilty when they meet their fate?

Meanwhile Giles is undergoing his own identity crisis - should he try to erase the past, or embrace it?
name: Slayer, Interrupted - Act 3

description: In the final chapter of the four-issue story arc, "Slayer Interrupted", Buffy discovers a terrible secret about the mental institution she's been committed to. It's up to her to save a group of young girls from the demon that uses the institution's patients as pawns in a scheme to take over the world.
name: Slayer, Interrupted - Act 4

description:
Overview

Buffy Summers has faced vampires, demons and monsters but now she must face the scariest thing of all: the divorce of her parents! But with divorce comes all the bad feelings attached to it, for all the members of the family, and those bad feelings take on physical shapes. No vampire is safe as the tortured young Slayer takes her anger and frustrations to the streets of L.A. All the while she is being closely watched by the mysterious vampire with a soul, Angel.
name: A Stake to the Heart - Act 1: Deceit

description: Buffy Summers's life is in shambles. She's been kicked out of school, recently released from a mental institution, and, to top it all off her parents' crumbling marriage is finally over. Now her would-be protector, the vampire Angel, has unwittingly unleashed a string of demons upon her, in an incredibly misguided attempt to alleviate her grief. Don't miss one of the hottest teams in comics telling the story of one of the darkest chapters in Buffy Summers' life, set before the premiere of the cult favorite television show!
name: A Stake to the Heart - Act 2: Guilt

description:
Overview

Buffy Summers, the Chosen One, the Slayer, is dealing with a horror she is powerless to stop -- the divorce of her parents. Adolescence is tough enough without the added distress of parental separation, not to mention the responsibilities of the one who stands alone against the powers of darkness. Now, in a failed attempt to alleviate Buffy's anxiety, the vampire with a soul, known as Angel, has unwittingly unleashed the Malignancy Demons upon her and her family. They feed on the pain of the Summers' family and bring to life the negative emotions which grip them. Buffy has faced Deceit and Guilt she must now face Abandonment. Be there for part 3 of "A Stake to the Heart" from Fabian Nicieza, Scott Lobdell, and Cliff Richards!
name: A Stake to the Heart - Act 3: Abandonment

description:
Deadpool teams up with the always-prickly Taskmaster! Will this team-up be brains over brawn? Or Deadpool’s brains splattered over Taskmaster’s feet?

Deadpool was having a drink with Taskmaster, who had discovered that Deadpool's deteriorating mental condition was caused by the Black Swan: a mercenary with unspecified mental powers( who even Taskmaster underestimated). Deadpool then took a job from a business man who was being harassed by a former employee whom he had fired on his birthday. When trying to complete the job, Deadpool was overcome by an excruciating head-ache. Despite the pain, he was able to tie his target's shoe-laces together and shove him out the window. After returning to his client, his son (who was a mutant) showed Deadpool a picture he saw in a dream. It was of a black swan above Deadpool's bloody body lying on the ground. Deadpool then discovered that his assistant, Sandi, was in the hospital.
name: Healing Factor - chapter 3: Headbanger's Ball

description:
This is it! Deadpool finally gets to battle Black Swan’s forces directly. Witness the action in one of Deadpool’s most dangerous missions yet!

Sandi was in the hospital, after being beaten by her boyfriend. Despite Deadpool's protests, she made him promise that he wouldn't kill the boyfriend. However, Deadpool beat him severely, but Taskmaster didn't make any promises. Deadpool then went to confront Black Swan about his mental virus. He brought a time-bomb and forced Black Swan to fix Ratbag's mind. However, they discovered that Swan couldn't fix Deadpool. They fought, with Deadpool emerging as the victor (although he lost a hand in the process). Unfortunately, the deactivation code was written on the severed hand and the bomb detonated; ending the series in a fiery explosion.

This series continues in Agent X Issue 1, whose cover poses for that issue are exactly the same as this issue.
name: Healing Factor - chapter 4: Finale

description: Straight from the pages of UNCANNY X-MEN #371, X-MEN #91 and X-MEN 1999 comes fast-paced super hero action spiced with a sci-fi twist!  Once he was Machine Man, an artificial adventurer in search of his own humanity. Now the classic Kirby character is back and updated for the new millennium! The only trouble is, he¹s dead... but does his memory live on?! Learn exactly what we mean when a mysterious federal agent, assigned the task of tracing the late automaton¹s history, discovers much more than he bargained for as he finds himself caught in the crossfire between U.S. government forces and the all-new Brotherhood of Mutants! Super hero adventure? Check! Hi-tech action? Check! X-Men tie-in? Check! This model is stacked with the thrills you crave, so jack in to X-51!  Written by the tag-team of Michael Higgins and Karl Bollers with pencils by Joe Bennett (NOVA, Buffy The Vampire Slayer).
name: The Persistence Of Memory

description: Straight from the pages of UNCANNY X-MEN #371, X-MEN #91 and X-MEN 1999 comes fast-paced super hero action spiced with a sci-fi twist!  Once he was Machine Man, an artificial adventurer in search of his own humanity. Now the classic Kirby character is back and updated for the new millennium! The only trouble is, he¹s dead... but does his memory live on?! Learn exactly what we mean when a mysterious federal agent, assigned the task of tracing the late automaton¹s history, discovers much more than he bargained for as he finds himself caught in the crossfire between U.S. government forces and the all-new Brotherhood of Mutants! Super hero adventure? Check! Hi-tech action? Check! X-Men tie-in? Check! This model is stacked with the thrills you crave, so jack in to X-51!  Written by the tag-team of Michael Higgins and Karl Bollers with pencils by Joe Bennett (NOVA, Buffy The Vampire Slayer).
name: Ghost In The Shell

description: Who, or what, is X.E.R.O.?!  Unable to maintain the human guise of Aaron Stack, X-51 finds himself a fugitive from the law! And to add to the heat, fanatical federal agent Peter Gyrich and a foe of the X-Men (whose identity we¹ll keep secret for now) also want to pull the plug on our beleaguered Machine Man! And wait¹ll you see Xero, the technological terror that they intend to unleash upon him!  But what strange and sinister connection links him to our beloved X-51?!  We¹ll give you a hint: he harkens back to the very beginning of it all and adds disturbing depth to the Machine Man mythos!
name: X.E.R.O. Tolerance

description: Guest-starring the Avengers! X-51, still on the run from the federal government, seeks solace in New York City with the one group he trusts: the Earth's Mightiest Heroes! But just as he finds sanctuary, the mechanical misanthrope runs afoul of their newest additions, Justice and Firestar! Poor Jarvis may just have to put in for overtime after this trio gets done trashing the Mansion! And if the Machine Man appears, can the synthezoid known as the Vision be far behind?
name: With friends like these...

description: It's machine man against android: X-51 vs. the Vision! M-Tech's mechanical mainstay goes for a round of "Rock 'Em Sock 'Em Robots" when he collides with the premier artificial being in the Marvel Universe --the amazing Avenger known as the Vision! Meanwhile, the relentless agents of the federal government--including Henry Gyrich--close in on our beleaguered hero. Even if X-51 defeats the Vision, he may get his plug pulled by his pursuers!
name: Circuits Maximus

description: It's the all-new Sentinel series vs. X-51 (who's part Sentinel himself)... with the X-Men waiting in the wings! Before X-51 exposes the long-hidden secrets of the leader of the Hellfire Club, Sebastian Shaw sends a new series of Sentinels to utterly destroy him! And just when things appear darkest, bursting through the rubble comes the Uncanny X-Men!
name: A View To A Kill

description: The Sentinels usually reserve their robotic wrath for mutants such as the X-Men. But now, the X is on another target when the Hellfire Club's Sebastian Shaw sends the cybernetic sentries on the trail of X-51! Featuring a cover by X-guy Alan Davis.
name: The Harder They Fall

description: Guest-starring the X-Men! What happens when X-51's robotic systems, corrupted by Sentinel programs, compel him to respond to the X-Men with unbridled violence?! How will Wolverine, Shadowcat, Psylocke, Angel, Jubilee and Nightcrawler deal with the massively enhanced Machine Man?! And where does Sebastian Shaw fit into it all! It's mutant mayhem to kick off the millennium... and it all ties in to UNCANNY X-MEN #377 and WOLVERINE #147!
name: Aftermath

description: Faced with the danger he posed to both man and mutantkind, X-51 has made a noble sacrifice, and battles on in cyberspace! Now the Machine Man must purge the mutant- hating Sentinel programs from his system, or lose himself forever!
name: Starting Over

description: A gang of street toughs from Central City have gained control of an alien weapon of unspeakable power?and only Machine Man has a chance of saving the town from devastation. Unfortunately, X-51 is a hunted outlaw and can't perform his robotic magic in public view! Can Aaron Stark alone save the city?
name: Warzone 1: Road Rage

description: What do you do when a gang of outlaw bikers get their hands on advanced Celestial technology? You run the other way! But if you're X-51, you dig in and protect your town from this deadly new breed of killer cyborgs!
name: Warzone 2: Communion

description: X.E.R.O. and X-51 face-off in a fuses-fying final issue! But is it just a battle for mere survival, or is it a struggle that will determine the next stage in man's evolutionary development? Hey! It's that black rectangular thing from 2001: A Space Odyssey!
name: Space Odyssey
